histogram.name: BrowserDialogs.ExternalProtocol.HandleState
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user checked the option in the external protocol dialog to remember their choice of opening or not opening the specified app. Recorded each time the user interacts with the External Protocol Dialog, when making a decision.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action
histogram.summary:
Tracks user interactions on permission prompts, aggregated across all UI dispositions, including quiet permission prompts due to CPSS or Crowd Deny.
One sample is recorded each time a permission request triggers a prompt, even if the prompt UI is never seen by the user. This histogram does not include permission requests that are granted/denied because the user had previously made a decision; nor requests that are denied by Permission Policy, per-site permission embargo, or are cancelled while queued.
The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.WithDisposition.{DispositionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the action that a user had taken per permission prompt UI disposition. Suffixed by the UI disposition that the prompt used. Recorded when a permission prompt has been resolved.

variant.name: AnchoredBubble
variant.summary: A bubble under the site settings padlock

variant.name: LocationBarLeftChip
variant.summary: A chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that shows a bubble when clicked

variant.name: LocationBarLeftChipAutoBubble
variant.summary: A chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that automatically shows a bubble

variant.name: LocationBarLeftQuietAbusiveChip
variant.summary: A less prominent, non-animated version of a chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that shows a bubble when clicked

variant.name: LocationBarLeftQuietChip
variant.summary: A less prominent version of a chip on the left-hand side of the location bar that shows a bubble when clicked

variant.name: LocationBarRightAnimatedIcon
variant.summary: An animated indicator on the right-hand side of the location bar

variant.name: LocationBarRightStaticIcon
variant.summary: A static indicator on the right-hand side of the location bar

variant.name: MessageUI
variant.summary: A message bubble near top of the screen and below the location bar (alternative to Infobar UI)

variant.name: MiniInfobar
variant.summary: An initially-collapsed infobar at the bottom of the page

variant.name: NoneVisible
variant.summary: There was no UI being shown

histogram.name: Permissions.API.CreatedPermissionStatusObjects
histogram.summary: Records the number of PermissionStatus handles that have been created by a document (via the "navigator.permissions" API). Recorded at the destruction of said document. Only recorded if the document has created at least one PermissionStatus handle.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.EmbargoPromptSuppression
histogram.summary:
For every permission request that would show a prompt to the user, this metric tracks whether the request is suppressed by embargo (and the source of that embargo), or whether there is no embargo and the prompt is shown. This is the proportion of permission prompts that the user would have seen that have been blocked due to embargo.
If the (origin, permission) pair was previously placed under embargo, no prompt is displayed and the reason for embargo is recorded. Otherwise, the prompt is shown and a no embargo reason is recorded.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.EmbargoStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason that an (origin, permission) pair has been placed under embargo (blocked from making requests for that permission for a period of time). This is triggered when a permission is placed under embargo for blacklisting (once Safe Browsing has returned a result), when a permission prompt has been shown and it is placed under embargo for repeated dismissals, or when a permission prompt is shown and not embargoed.

histogram.name: Permissions.BatteryLevel.Accepted.Geolocation
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2022, as it's been unused for some time.
histogram.summary: Battery percentage when a geolocation permission prompt was accepted on Android.

histogram.name: Permissions.BatteryLevel.Accepted.LocationSettingsDialog
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2022, as it's been unused for some time.
histogram.summary: Battery percentage when a location settings dialog was accepted.

histogram.name: Permissions.BatteryLevel.Denied.Geolocation
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2022, as it's been unused for some time.
histogram.summary: Battery percentage when a geolocation permission prompt was denied on Android.

histogram.name: Permissions.BatteryLevel.Denied.LocationSettingsDialog
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2022, as it's been unused for some time.
histogram.summary: Battery percentage when a location settings dialog was denied.

histogram.name: Permissions.BatteryLevel.Dismissed.Geolocation
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2022, as it's been unused for some time.
histogram.summary: Battery percentage when a geolocation permission prompt was dismissed on Android.

histogram.name: Permissions.Chip.TimeToDecision.{RequestAction}
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to make a decision about permission request when chip request UI is shown, from when permission prompt is shown until when the user clicks on one of the buttons in the prompt (accept, block or close).

histogram.name: Permissions.Chip.TimeToInteraction
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to click on the permission chip after it was shown.

histogram.name: Permissions.ConfirmationChip.PageInfoDialogAccessType
histogram.summary: Record each time the page info bubble is opened through either the lock icon or the confirmation chip, how it was opened and how the opening related to the confirmation chip.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.DidHoldbackQuietUi
histogram.summary: Whenever a notification permission prompt is to be displayed, crowd deny might trigger based on site reputation which will result in a quiet permission prompt UI to be used. Whenever this happens, there is a small chance that the normal UI will still be used. This records, when a quiet UI is supposed to be shown, whether it has been randomly selected into the hold-back group. In this case the normal UI will be displayed unless overriden by the user Prefences.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.PreloadData.DelayedPushNotification
histogram.summary: Record, for each incoming push notification, a delay caused by loading Crowd Deny component during abusive an origin verification. It's recorded only for non-abusive origins and only if the Crowd Deny request was made while the preload data is in the process of being loaded. Timing starts at requesting CrowdDenyPreloadData::GetReputationDataForSiteAsync, and timing ends after Crowd Deny returns result to AbusiveOriginPermissionRevocationRequest::OnSiteReputationReady.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.PreloadData.NotificationUxQuality
histogram.summary: Records, each time a notification permission prompt is about to be shown, the NotificationUxQuality result for the requesting origin.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.PreloadData.VersionAtAbuseCheckTime
histogram.summary: Records, each time abusive origin verification is performed, the version of the Crowd Deny preload data on disk (not necessarily loaded).

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.PreloadData.WarningOnly
histogram.summary: Records, each time a notification permission prompt is about to be shown, the whether there is preload data that indicates the origin being on a warning list.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.SafeBrowsing.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: Records, each time a Safe Browsing request is made in response to a website requesting the notification permission, how long that Safe Browsing request took. This also includes all delays introduced by thread hopping.

histogram.name: Permissions.CrowdDeny.SafeBrowsing.Verdict
histogram.summary: Records, each time a Safe Browsing request is made in response to a website requesting the notification permission, the Safe Browsing verdict regarding the notification prompt experience on that site.

histogram.name: Permissions.DSE.AutoPermissionRevertTransition
histogram.summary: Recorded when the Default Search Engine automatic permission grant is reverted. It tracks the transition that the settings for the DSE origin takes when this happens. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type.

histogram.name: Permissions.DSE.EffectiveSetting
histogram.summary: Recorded at initialization and when the Default Search Engine origin is changed. Tracks the setting for the Default Search Engine origin. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type.

histogram.name: Permissions.DSE.InvalidAutoPermissionRevertTransition.BackedUpSetting
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2022, since the data it provides is no longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Recorded when the Default Search Engine automatic permission grant is reverted and the recorded transition is invalid. Used to help investigate the scenario in which this happens. Records the backed up setting for the DSE origin, which is the setting that was in effect before the DSE autogrant overwrote it in the first place. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type.

histogram.name: Permissions.DSE.InvalidAutoPermissionRevertTransition.EffectiveSetting
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2022, since the data it provides is no longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Recorded when the Default Search Engine automatic permission grant is reverted and the recorded transition is invalid. Used to help investigate the scenario in which this happens. Records the effecting setting for the DSE origin, which is the setting that was in effect before the revert. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type.

histogram.name: Permissions.DSE.InvalidAutoPermissionRevertTransition.EndStateSetting
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2022, since the data it provides is no longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Recorded when the Default Search Engine automatic permission grant is reverted and the recorded transition is invalid. Used to help investigate the scenario in which this happens. Records the end state setting for the DSE origin, which is the setting that is in effect after the revert. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type.

histogram.name: Permissions.Engagement.Accepted
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user accepts the permission prompt. It tracks the Site engagement score for sites. For more info check chrome/browser/engagement/

histogram.name: Permissions.Engagement.AcceptedOnce
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user accepts the one time permission prompt. It tracks the Site engagement score for sites. For more info check chrome/browser/engagement/

histogram.name: Permissions.Engagement.Denied
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user denies the permission prompt. It tracks the Site engagement score for sites. For more info check chrome/browser/engagement/

histogram.name: Permissions.Engagement.Dismissed
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user dismisses the permission prompt. It tracks the Site engagement score for sites. For more info check chrome/browser/engagement/

histogram.name: Permissions.Engagement.Ignored
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user ignores the permission prompt. It tracks the Site engagement score for sites. For more info check chrome/browser/engagement/

histogram.name: Permissions.MissingOSLevelPermission.Action
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Chrome needs permission..." infobar is resolved. Records the resulting action that was taken. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type.

histogram.name: Permissions.MissingOSLevelPermission.ShouldShow
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Chrome needs permission..." infobar might be displayed to the user because a site already has the permission but Chrome does not. Records whether the infobar should be displayed or not. Ignores situations when the infobar cannot be displayed (for example because there is no appropriate web contents) as in those cases no decision is actually made. Suffixed by `PermissionTypes` to provide information per permission type.

histogram.name: Permissions.OnDevicePredictionService.Response.{PermissionType}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the permissions prediction service(on-device) responds to a {PermissionType} permission request. Records whether its response was ignored or not.

histogram.name: Permissions.PageInfo.ChangedWithin1m.{PermissionType}
histogram.summary: This metric measures how often and in what way users change their mind within the first minute of making an active permission decision, i.e. any PermissionAction that is any action that is not ignore, dismiss or an automated revoke event.

histogram.name: Permissions.PredictionService.GeolocationRequest
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 02/2022. Replaced with the newer histogram Permissions.PredictionService.GeolocationResponse
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a geolocation permission request is eligible for Permissions predictions service. Records whether the request was sent to the backend or if it was held back.

histogram.name: Permissions.PredictionService.PredictionSource
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission is sent to the prediction service. Records whether the request was sent to the local on-device prediction service or the server side prediction service.

histogram.name: Permissions.PredictionService.Request
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 02/2022. Replaced with the newer histogram Permissions.PredictionService.NotificationResponse
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a notification permission request is eligible for Permissions predictions service. Records whether the request was sent to the backend or if it was held back.

histogram.name: Permissions.PredictionService.Response.{PermissionType}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the permissions prediction service(server-side) responds to a {PermissionType} permission request. Records whether its response was ignored or not.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted
histogram.summary: Tracks the permission bubbles (merged and non-merged) that are accepted. Merged bubbles are considered accepted if all permissions are allowed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorDismissCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorIgnoreCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.AcceptedOnce
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user clicks on the one-time allow button of the permission prompt. Tracks the permission bubbles (merged and non-merged) that are accepted once. Merged bubbles are considered accepted if all permissions are allowed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.AcceptedOnce.PriorDismissCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt one-time accept, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.AcceptedOnce.PriorIgnoreCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt one-time accept, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied
histogram.summary: Tracks the permission bubbles (merged and non-merged) that are denied. Merged bubbles are considered denied if any permission is denied.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorDismissCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorIgnoreCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorDismissCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorIgnoreCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorDismissCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorIgnoreCount2
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user explicitly set the permission state or cleared history / site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Infobar.DetailsExpanded
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the user has expanded the infobar notification permission request.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Notifications.EnabledAppLevel
histogram.summary: Records whether chrome has notifications already enabled at the app level or at least is allowed to request for app level permission. When none of these conditions are true, site level notification permissions are blocked. Recorded when a site attempts to prompt the user for notifications permission. Android only.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Shown
histogram.summary: Tracks how many times permission prompts are shown to users.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.TimeToDecision.{RequestAction}
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to make a decision about permission request when prompt request UI is shown, from when permission prompt is shown until when the user clicks on one of the buttons in the prompt (accept, block or close).

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks the action that a user had taken for a {PermissionType} permission prompt with disposition of type {Disposition}. Recorded when a permission prompt has been resolved.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.Ignored.DidShowBubble
histogram.summary: Records if a permission prompt bubble of type {PermissionType} was displayed as a result of a user having clicked on a chip with disposition {Disposition} that was subsequently ignored. Chip framework is only available on Desktop.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.{Action}.TimeToAction
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to take the {Action} action on a prompt of type {PermissionType} with {Disposition} disposition. The Ignored state will be recorded if the user closes the tab or a permission chip gets expired.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.{PermissionType}.{Disposition}.{Action}.{ButtonClick}
histogram.summary: Recrods {ButtonClick} if a user clicked on "Leanr More" or "Manage" buttons on the quiet chip of type {PermissionType} with {Disposition} disposition. Recorded when the permission prompt gets resolved with {Action} action and only for the quiet chip.

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietChip.TimeToInteraction
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for the user to click on the quiet chip after it was shown. Chip framework is only available on Desktop. Recorded only if the user clicks on the quiet chip. We can learn what % of prompts get ignored by comparing this metric and `PermissionPromptDisposition.LocationBarLeftQuietChip`.

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietNotificationPrompts.DidEnableAdapativelyInPrefs
histogram.summary: Records, each time the quiet UI gets enabled in preferences, whether it was enabled by the adaptive activation logic.

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietNotificationPrompts.EnabledStateInPrefsChangedTo
histogram.summary: Records when the quiet notification permission UI state changes, that is, it either gets enabled or disabled, in preferences.

histogram.name: Permissions.QuietNotificationPrompts.IsEnabledInPrefs
histogram.summary: Records whether the quiet notification permission UI is enabled in preferences at profile creation. No sample recorded when notifications are set to be blocked completely.

histogram.name: Permissions.Revocation.ElapsedTimeSinceGrant
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed since the grant of the permission until it's revoked.

histogram.name: Permissions.Serial.ChooserClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the Serial API chooser, triggered by a call to navigator.serial.requestPort(), was closed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Serial.Revoked
histogram.summary: Records when permission to access a serial port is revoked.

histogram.name: Permissions.Usage.ElapsedTimeSinceGrant
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed since the grant of the permission until it's latest usage. This histogram will be recorded only for the first usage of a given permission after the site has loaded.

histogram.name: Permissions.WebHid.ChooserClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the WebHID device chooser was closed.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.DaysSinceLastShortcutLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of days between launches of an origin saved to homescreen or as a bookmark app shortcut. Recorded at the second and each following launch of a specific origin from a shortcut, independently per origin.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScoreBucket
histogram.summary: The percentage of sites on a user's profile that have engagement scores that fall in these buckets, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementType
histogram.summary: The type of engagement (navigation, user input, etc.) which led to an accumulation in site engagement.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MeanEngagement
histogram.summary: The mean site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MedianEngagement
histogram.summary: The median site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsEngaged
histogram.summary: The total number of origins with a non-zero site engagement score for this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsWithMaxDailyEngagement
histogram.summary: The number of origins which have reached the daily site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Thus, each bin N contains the number of clients where at least N origins have reached the maximum daily site engagement point cap.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsWithMaxEngagement
histogram.summary: The number of origins which have reached the absolute site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Thus, each bin N contains the number of clients where at least N origins have reached the maximum absolute site engagement point cap.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.TotalEngagement
histogram.summary: The total site engagement accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the website setting (a.k.a. page info / origin info) bubble, such as opening it up or clicking on the Connection tab.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.AllSitesAction
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the "All Sites" page in website settings for builds older than M82.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.AllSitesAction2
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the "All Sites" page in website settings starting in M82. No data available for M94, was temporarily expired. Values 7 and 8 were added with M96.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks actions related to page info when discoverability has been activated.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.TimeToClickHighlight
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time between when the page info is opened and the highlighted permissions section is clicked.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.TimeToClickHighlightStoreInfo
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time between when the page info is opened and the highlighted store info section is clicked.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.TimeToOpen
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the discoverability icon is shown in the omnibox before the user clicks into page info.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.TimeToOpenFromStoreIcon
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the store icon is shown in the omnibox before the user clicks into page info.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.GetAllSitesLoadTime
histogram.summary: Records the load time of the "All sites" settings page. The load time is the time between the "GetAllSites" request start and the time when the storage is fetched and the full information is returned to the UI.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M81, stopped emitting in M100.
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Allowed
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M81, stopped emitting in M100.
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Allowed' using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Ask
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M77, stopped emitting in M100.
histogram.summary: Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Ask' using the content settings menu.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Blocked
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M81, stopped emitting in M100.
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Blocked' using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Reset
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M77, stopped emitting in M100.
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is reset to the default value using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.SessionOnly
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M96, stopped emitting in M100.
histogram.summary: Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed to the session only value using the content settings menu. This option only exists for cookies.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Allowed
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Allowed' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Blocked
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Blocked' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.
